name: sugarcane production | sugarcane | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14769/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Sugarcane during March, 2016- February, 2017 data being average of two farms, one located in Village-Rattipur, District- Ludhiana of Punjab and the other in Village-Kabulpur, District-Jagadhri of Haryana. In these areas, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump and diesel pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 85,500 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Mean sowing date for the crop is 21-March, 2016 and harvesting date is 14-Feburary, 2017. Mineral NP fertilizer input is 160-115 kg/ha.Herbicide used has active ingredient as Attrazine 2000g/ha. Insecticides used have active ingredient of Fipronyl 7500g/ha, Chlorpyriphos 2000 ml/ha, Chlorantraniliprole 75 ml/ha for which Clothianidin has been taken as proxy. Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 89.44 kg/ha using plough, rotary cultivator for soil tillage and other planking. For sowing and planting fuel consumption of 29.64 kg/ha using Trench marking. Machines used for fertilization with fuel consumption of 3.12 kg/ha by mixing with soil and for other work process like laser levelling 14.2272 kg/ha of fuel is been put to use.  

This activity starts about two weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in March and sowing of seeds started about three weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 11 months.

 The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Sugarcane
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0114:Growing of sugar cane

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 01-March, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 14-Feburary, 2017. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 330 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Sugarcane follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of sugarcane is calculated to be circa 1.35E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'atrazine', 'cyclic N-compound', 'nitrile-compound', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.71E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'sugarcane' is calculated to be circa 3.22E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 6.43E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
